meanings.definition: Kludgier (comparative adjective): More awkwardly or inelegantly made or done.
meanings.sent1: The new chair was kludgier than the old one.
meanings.sent2: She tried to fix the broken toy, but it ended up even kludgier.
meanings.sent3: The robot's dance moves were so kludgier, it looked like it was doing the robot dance.
meanings.sent4: His attempt at painting the sunset was kludgier than a child's finger painting.
meanings.sent5: The cake she baked was a kludgier version of the one in the recipe book.

meanings.definition: Kludgier (adverb): In a more awkward or inelegant manner.
meanings.sent1: He walked kludgier than usual in his new shoes.
meanings.sent2: She typed kludgier on the keyboard with her injured hand.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to pull off the trick kludgier than a beginner.
meanings.sent4: The car moved kludgier as it ran out of gas.
meanings.sent5: The dancer moved kludgier as the music slowed down.
